data.title: The renovation of the Csapókerti community house will start in autumn
data.meta_description: Now the organizations operating in the building are looking for alternative accommodation for the investment duration, Mayor László Papp announced at the Csapókerti Neighborhood Day on September 18th, 2021. Member of Parliament László Tasó emphasized that every effort should be made to support NGOs that strengthen the self-awareness of Hungarians.
data.text:
The Csapókerti Neighborhood Day was not organized due to COVID-19 in 2020, but the event was organized this year. There are many associations and organizations in the district that are happy to take part in community events.

At the opening of the neighborhood day, Mayor László Papp said that one of the best news was that people could meet in person again. The other one was that the renovation of the Csapókerti Community House could start this year; therefore, the building will be closed in mid-October.

We are now working to ensure that the NGOs operating here and the Főnix Néptáncegyüttes (Phoenix Folk Dance Ensemble) are properly accommodated during the transition period. The work will start in November, and we would like to hand over the renovated and refurbished Csapókerti Community House in a year’s time, the mayor said.

Member of Parliament László Tasó emphasized the need for such gatherings. The role of community life is essential for which well-functioning NGOs are needed.

There are many non-governmental associations (NGOs) in this area, and they represent a value, the lack of which would weaken the self-awareness of the Hungarians, so they must be taken care of, and a good example must always be presented to others, Tasó said.

The Csapókerti Neighborhood Day was held for the 16th time this year.

Source: dehir.hu
